   34:          init_per_group/2,
   35:          end_per_group/2,

   37:          end_per_testcase/2
   38:         ]).

   72:          kex_error/1,
   73:          interrupted_send/1,
   74:          max_channels_option/1,
   75:          no_sensitive_leak/1,
   76:          ptty_alloc/1,
   77:          ptty_alloc_default/1,
   78:          ptty_alloc_pixel/1,
   79:          read_write_loop/1,
   80:          read_write_loop1/2,
   81:          send_after_exit/1,
   82:          simple_eval/1,
   83:          simple_exec/1,
   84:          simple_exec_sock/1,
   85:          simple_exec_two_socks/1,
   86:          small_cat/1,
   87:          small_interrupted_send/1,
   88:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write/1,
   89:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced/1,
   90:          start_shell/1,
   91:          new_shell_dumb_term/1,
   92:          new_shell_xterm_term/1,
   93:          start_shell_pty/1,

   95:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun/1,
   96:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error/1,
   97:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type/1,
   98:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun2/1,
   99:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun3/1,
  100:          start_shell_exec_fun/1,
  101:          start_shell_exec_fun2/1,
  102:          start_shell_exec_fun3/1,
  103:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,
  104:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi/1,
  105:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,
  106:          start_subsystem_on_closed_channel/1,
  107:          stop_listener/1,
  108:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  109:         ]).
  110: 
  111: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  112: 
  113: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  114: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: 
  117: %% suite() ->
  118: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  119: 
  120: suite() ->
  121:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  122: 
  123: all() ->
  124:     [
  125:      {group, openssh},
  126:      small_interrupted_send,
  127:      interrupted_send,
  128:      exec_erlang_term,
  129:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  130:      exec_disabled,
  131:      exec_shell_disabled,
  132:      start_shell,
  133:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  134:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  135:      start_shell_pty,
  136:      start_shell_exec,
  137:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  138:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  139:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  140:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  141:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  142:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  143:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  145:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  146:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  147:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  148:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  149:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  150:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  151:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  152:      connect2_invalid_options,
  153:      connect_invalid_port,
  154:      connect_invalid_options,
  155:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  156:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  157:      connect3_invalid_port,
  158:      connect3_invalid_options,
  159:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  160:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  161:      connect3_invalid_both,
  162:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  163:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  164:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  165:      connect4_invalid_three,
  166:      connect_timeout,
  167:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  168:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  169:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  170:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  171:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  172:      kex_error,
  173:      stop_listener,
  174:      no_sensitive_leak,
  175:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  176:      max_channels_option
  177:     ].
  178: groups() ->
  179:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  180: 
  181: payload() ->
  182:     [simple_exec,
  183:      simple_exec_sock,
  184:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  185:      small_cat,
  186:      big_cat,
  187:      send_after_exit].
  188: 
  189: ptty() ->
  190:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  191:      ptty_alloc,
  192:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  193: 
  194: sock() ->
  195:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  196:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  197:     ].
  198: 
  199: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  200: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  201:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  202:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  203:         | Config]
  204:       ).
  205: 
  206: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  207:     catch ssh:stop(),
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  211: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  212:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  213: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  214: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  215: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  216: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  217: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  218:     end;
  219: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  220:     Config.
  221: 
  222: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  223:     Config.
  224: 
  225: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  226: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  227:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  228:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  229:     end_per_testcase(any, Config),
  230:     ssh:start(),
  231:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config).
  232: 
  233: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  234:     ssh:stop().
  235: 
  236: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  238: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  239: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  240:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  241:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  242: 
  243: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  244: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  245:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  246:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  247:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  248:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  249:                                             ]),
  250:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  251: 
  252: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  253: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  254:     Parent = self(),
  255:     F = fun() ->
  256:                 spawn_link(
  257:                   fun() ->
  258:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  259:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  260:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  261:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  262:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  263:                   end)
  264:         end,
  265:     Pid1 = F(),
  266:     Pid2 = F(),
  267:     receive
  268:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  269:     end,
  270:     receive
  271:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  272:     end.
  273: 
  274: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  275: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  276:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  277: 
  278: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  279:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  280: 
  281: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  282:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  283: 
  284: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  285:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  286:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  287: 
  288: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  289:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  290:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  291: 
  292: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  293:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  294:     {error, _Reason} =
  295:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  296: 
  297: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  298:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  299: 
  300:     {error, invalid_port} =
  301:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  302:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  303:                      {user, "foo"},
  304:                      {password, "morot"},
  305:                      {user_interaction, false},
  306:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  307:                     infinity),
  308: 
  309:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  310: 
  311: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  312:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  313: 
  314:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  315:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  316:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  317:                      {user, "foo"},
  318:                      {password, "morot"},
  319:                      {user_interaction, false},
  320:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  321:                    longer),
  322: 
  323:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  324: 
  325: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  326:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  327: 
  328:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  329:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  330:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  331:                      {user, "foo"},
  332:                      {password, "morot"},
  333:                      {user_interaction, false},
  334:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  335:                    -1),
  336: 
  337:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  338: 
  339: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  340:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  341: 
  342:     {error, invalid_options} =
  343:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  344:                     {user, "foo"},
  345:                     infinity),
  346: 
  347:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  348: 
  349: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  350: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  351:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  352: 
  353:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  354:     {error, _} =
  355:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  356:                     {user, "foo"},
  357:                     infinity),
  358: 
  359:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  360: 
  361: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  362:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  363: 
  364:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  365:     {error, _} =
  366:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  367:                     {user, "foo"},
  368:                     short),
  369: 
  370:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  371: 
  372: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  373:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  374: 
  375:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  376:     {error, _} =
  377:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  378:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  379:                     -1),
  380: 
  381:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  382: 
  383: %% All three args incorrect
  384: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  385:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  386: 
  387:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  388:     {error, _} =
  389:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  390:                     {user, "foo"},
  391:                     fortnight),
  392: 
  393:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  394: 
  395: daemon_start(Config) ->
  396:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  397:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  398:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  399:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  400: 
  401:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  402:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  403:                                              {password, "morot"},
  404:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  405:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  406: 
  407: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  408: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  409:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  410:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  411:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  412:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  413:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  414: 
  415: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  416: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  417:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  418:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  419:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  420:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  421:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  422:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  423: 
  424: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  425: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  426:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  427:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  428:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  429: 
  430: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  431: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  432:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  433:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  434:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  435:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  436:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  437: 
  438: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  439: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  440:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  441:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  442:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  443: 
  444: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  445: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  446:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  447:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  448:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  449: 				  "cat", infinity),
  450: 
  451:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  452:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  453:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  454: 
  455:     %% receive response to input
  456:     receive
  457: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  458: 	    ok
  459:     after 
  460: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  461:     end,
  462: 
  463:     %% receive close messages
  464:     receive
  465: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  466: 	    ok
  467:     after 
  468: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  469:     end,
  470:     receive
  471: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  472: 	    ok
  473:     after 
  474: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  475:     end,
  476:     receive
  477: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  478: 	    ok
  479:     after 
  480: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  481:     end.
  482: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  483: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  485: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  486:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  487:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  488: 				  "cat", infinity),
  489: 
  490:     %% build 10MB binary
  491:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  492: 
  493:     %% pre-adjust receive window so the other end doesn't block
  494:     ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, size(Data)),
  495: 
  496:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  497:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  498:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  499: 
  500:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  501:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  502: 	{ok, Data} ->
  503: 	    ok;
  504: 	{ok, Other} ->
  505: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  506: 		true ->
  507: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  508: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  509: 		false ->
  510: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  511: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  512: 	    end,
  513: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  514: 	Else ->
  515: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  516:     end,
  517: 
  518:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  519:     receive
  520: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  521: 	    ok 
  522:     after 
  523: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  524:     end,
  525:     receive
  526: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  527: 	    ok
  528:     after 
  529: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  530:     end.
  531: 
  532: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  533: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  535:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  536:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  537: 
  538:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  539:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  540: 				  "false", infinity),
  541:     receive
  542: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  543: 	    ok
  544:     after 
  545: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  546:     end,
  547:     receive
  548: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  549: 	    ok
  550:     after 
  551: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  552:     end,
  553:     receive
  554: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  555: 	    ok
  556:     after 
  557: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  558:     end,
  559:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  560: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  561: 	ok ->
  562: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  563: 	{error, timeout} ->
  564: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  565: 	Else ->
  566: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  567:     end.
  568: 
  569: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  570: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  571:     Tags =
  572:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  573:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  574:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  575:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  576:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  577:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  578:     Opts =
  579:         lists:zip(Tags,
  580:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  581:     
  582:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  583:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  584:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  585:                 Opts ->
  586:                     ok;
  587:                 Other ->
  588:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  589:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  590:             end;
  591:         Other ->
  592:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  593:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  594:     end.
  595: 
  596: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  597: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  598:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  599:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  600:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  601:                  true -> success;
  602:                  false -> failure
  603:              end,
  604:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  605:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  606: 
  607: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  608: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  609:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  610:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  611:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  612:                  true -> success;
  613:                  false -> failure
  614:              end,
  615:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  616:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  617:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  618: 
  619: 
  620: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  621: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  622:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  623:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  624:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  625:                  true -> success;
  626:                  false -> failure
  627:              end,
  628:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  629:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  630:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  631: 
  632: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  633: small_interrupted_send(Config) -> 
  634:     K = 1024,
  635:     M = K*K,
  636:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*K).
  637: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  638:     M = 1024*1024,
  639:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*M).
  640: 
  641: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize) ->
  642:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  643:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  644:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  645:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  646:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  647:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  648: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  649: 					     {password, "morot"},
  650: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  651:     
  652:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  653:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  654: 						      {user, "foo"},
  655: 						      {password, "morot"},
  656: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  657: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  658:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  659: 
  660:     %% build big binary
  661:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  662: 
  663:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  664:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  665: 
  666:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  667:     Parent = self(),
  668:     ResultPid = spawn(
  669: 		  fun() ->
  670: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  671: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  672: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  673: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  674: 			      success ->
  675: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  676: 				  
  677: 				  Result = 
  678: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  679: 				      of
  680: 					  ExpectedData -> 
  681: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  682: 					      ok;
  683: 					  Other ->
  684: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  685: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  686: 				      catch
  687: 					  Class:Exception ->
  688: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  689: 				      end,
  690: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  691: 			      Other ->
  692: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  693: 			  end
  694: 		  end),
  695:     
  696:     receive
  697: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  698: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  699: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  700: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  701: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  702: 
  703: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  704: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  705: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  706: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  707: 			      end),
  708: 	    receive
  709: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  710: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  711: 		    {fail, Fail};
  712: 
  713: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  714: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  715: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  716: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  717: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  718: 		    receive
  719: 			{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  720: 			    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect :)",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  721: 			    ok;
  722: 			Msg ->
  723: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  724: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  725: 		    end;
  726: 
  727: 		{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  728: 		    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect, but client channel handler has not reported yet",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  729: 		    receive
  730: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  731: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  732: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  733: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  734: 			    ok;
  735: 			Msg ->
  736: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  737: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  738: 		    end;
  739: 
  740: 		Msg ->
  741: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  742: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  743: 	    end
  744:     end.
  745: 
  746: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  747: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  748:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  749:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  750:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  751:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  752:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  753: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  754: 					     {password, "morot"},
  755: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  756: 
  757:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  758: 						      {user, "foo"},
  759: 						      {password, "morot"},
  760: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  761: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  762:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  763:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  764:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  765:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  766: 
  767: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  768: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  769:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  770:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  771:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  772:                                ],
  773:                        exp_output =>
  774:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  775:                             <<"1> ">>,
  776:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  777:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  778:                             <<"2> ">>],
  779:                        unexp_output =>
  780:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  781:                     Config).
  782: 
  783: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  784: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  785:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  786:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  787:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  788:                                ],
  789:                        exp_output =>
  790:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  791:                             <<"1> ">>,
  792:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  793:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  794:                             <<"2> ">>,
  795:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  796:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  797:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  798:                     Config).
  799: 
  800: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  801:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  802:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  803:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  804:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  805:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  806:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  807:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  808: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  809: 					     {password, "morot"},
  810:                                              {subsystems, []},
  811:                                              {keepalive, true},
  812:                                              {nodelay, true},
  813:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  814:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  815:                                                      end}
  816:                                             ]),
  817:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  818: 						      {user, "foo"},
  819: 						      {password, "morot"},
  820: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  821:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  822:     success =
  823:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  824:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  825:                                   infinity),
  826:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  827:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  828:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  829:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  830:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  831:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  832:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  833: 
  834:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  835:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  836: 
  837: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  844: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  845: 					     {password, "morot"},
  846: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),

  849: 						      {user, "foo"},

  966: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  967:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  968:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  969:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  970:                                           end)
  971:                             end,
  972:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  973:                             Config).
  974: 
  975: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
  976:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
  977:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  978:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  979:                                           end)
  980:                             end,
  981:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  982:                             Config).
  983: 
  984: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
  985:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
  986:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  987:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  988:                                           end)
  989:                             end,
  990:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  991:                             Config).
  992: 
  993: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
  994:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
  995:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  996:                             Config).
  997: 
  998: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
  999:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1000:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1001:                             Config).
 1002: 
 1003: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1004:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1005:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1006:                             Config).
 1007: 
 1008: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1009:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1010:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1011:                             Config).
 1012: 
 1013: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1014:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1015:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1016:                             Config).
 1017: 
 1018: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1019:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1020:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1021:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1022:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1023:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1024: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1025: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1026: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1027: 
 1028:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1029:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1030:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1031:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1032:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1033: 
 1034:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1035: 
 1036:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1037:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1038: 
 1039:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1040:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1041:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1042: 
 1043:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1044:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1045:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1046:     receive
 1047:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1048:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1049:     end,
 1050:     receive
 1051:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1052:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1053:     end,
 1054:     receive
 1055:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1056:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1057:     end,
 1058:     receive
 1059:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1060:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1061:     after 0 -> go_on
 1062:     end,
 1063:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1064: 
 1065: 
 1066: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1067:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1068:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1069:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1070:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1071:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1072: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1073: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1074: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1075: 
 1076:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1077:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1078:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1079:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1080:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1081: 
 1082:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1083: 
 1084:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1085:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1086: 
 1087:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1088:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1089:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1090: 
 1091:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1092:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1093:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1094:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1095:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1096:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1097:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1098:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1099:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1100:     receive
 1101:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1102:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1103:     end,
 1104:     receive
 1105:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1106:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1107:     end,
 1108:     receive
 1109:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1110:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1111:     end,
 1112:     receive
 1113:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1114:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1115:     after 0 -> go_on
 1116:     end,
 1117:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1118: 
 1119: 
 1120: 
 1121:     
 1122: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1123: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1124:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1125:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1126: 
 1127: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1128:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1129:         {ok, quit} ->
 1130:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1131:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1132:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1133:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1134:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1135:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1136:     end.
 1137:     
 1138: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1139: 
 1140: 
 1141: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1142:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1143:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1144:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1145:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1146:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1147: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1148: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1149: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1150: 
 1151:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1152: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1153: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1154: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1155: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1156: 
 1157:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1158: 
 1159:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Command, infinity),
 1160: 
 1161:     receive
 1162: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1163: 	    ok
 1164:     after 5000 ->
 1165:             receive
 1166:                 Other ->
 1167:                     ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1168:                            [Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}} ]),
 1169:                     ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1170:             after 0 ->
 1171:                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1172:             end
 1173:     end,
 1174: 
 1175:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1176:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1177: 
 1178: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1179: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1180:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1181:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1182:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1183:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1184:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1185:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1186:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1187:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1188:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1189: 
 1190:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1191:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1192:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1193: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1194: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1195: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1196: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1197: 
 1198:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1199: 
 1200:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1201: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1202: 
 1203:     receive
 1204: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1205: 	    ok
 1206:     after 5000 ->
 1207: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1208:     end,
 1209: 
 1210:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1211:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1212: 
 1213: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1214: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1215:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1216:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1217:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1218:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1219: 
 1220:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1221:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1222:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1223: 
 1224:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1225:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1226: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1227: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1228: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1229: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1230: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1231: 	       end),
 1232: 
 1233:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1234:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1235:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1236:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1237: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1238: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1239: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1240: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1241: 
 1242:     %% And runs some commands
 1243:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1244: 
 1245:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1246: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1247: 
 1248:     receive
 1249: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1250: 	    ok
 1251:     after 5000 ->
 1252: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1253:     end,
 1254: 
 1255:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1256: 
 1257: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1258: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1259:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1260:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1261:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1262:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1263: 
 1264:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1265: 
 1266:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1267:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1268:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1269: 
 1270:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1271:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1272:                   {password, "morot"},
 1273:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1274: 
 1275:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1276:     Pids =
 1277:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1278:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1279:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1280:                     end)
 1281:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1282:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1283: 
 1284:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1285:     ConnectionRefs =
 1286:         [begin
 1287:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1288:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1289:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1290:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1291:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1292:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1293:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1294:              ConnectionRef
 1295:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1296:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1297: 
 1298:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1299:     Parent = self(),
 1300:     ClientPids =
 1301:         lists:map(
 1302:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1303:                   spawn_link(
 1304:                     fun() ->
 1305:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1306:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1307:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1308:                             receive
 1309:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1310:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1311:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1312:                             after 5000 ->
 1313:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1314:                             end
 1315:                     end)
 1316:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1317:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1318: 
 1319:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1320:                           receive
 1321:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1322:                           end
 1323:                   end, ClientPids),
 1324:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1325: 
 1326:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1327: 
 1328: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1329: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1330:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1331:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1332:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1333:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1334:     
 1335:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1336:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1337:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1338: 
 1339:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1340:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1341:     receive
 1342: 	Verstring ->
 1343: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1344: 	    receive
 1345: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1346: 		    ok
 1347: 	    end
 1348:     after 
 1349: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1350:     end.
 1351: 
 1352: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1353:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1354:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1355:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1356:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1357:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1358:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1359:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1360: 
 1361:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1362:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1363:     receive
 1364: 	Verstring ->
 1365: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1366: 	    receive
 1367: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1368: 		    ok
 1369: 	    end
 1370:     after 
 1371: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1372:     end.

 1374: gracefull_invalid_long_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

 1380:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1381:                                                {password, "morot"}]),

 1384:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),

 1400:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1401:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1402:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1403:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1404:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1405:

 1407:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1408:     receive
 1409: 	Verstring ->
 1410: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1411: 	    receive
 1412: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->

 1418: 
 1419: kex_error(Config) ->
 1420:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1421:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1422:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1423:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1424:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1425:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1426:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1427:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1428:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1429:                                              ]),
 1430:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1431:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1432:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1433:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1434:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1435:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1436:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1437:                                    ok % Other msg
 1438:                            end,
 1439:                            self()),
 1440:     try
 1441:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1442:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1443:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1444:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1445:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1446:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1447:                                          ])
 1448:     of
 1449:         _ ->
 1450:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1451:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1452:     catch
 1453:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1454:             %% ok
 1455:             receive
 1456:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1457:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1458:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1459:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1460:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1461:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1462:                                      "Details:",
 1463:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1464:                                      "we have:",
 1465:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1466:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1467:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1468:                     case OK of
 1469:                         true ->
 1470:                             ok;
 1471:                         false ->
 1472:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1473:                     end
 1474:             after 20000 ->
 1475:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1476:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1477:             end;
 1478: 
 1479:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1480:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1481:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1482:     end.
 1483: 
 1484: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1485:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1486:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1487:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1488:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1489:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1490: 
 1491:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1492: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1493: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1494: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1495: 
 1496:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1497:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1498:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1499:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1500:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1501:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1502:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1503:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1504: 
 1505:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1506: 
 1507:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1508:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1509:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1510: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1511: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1512: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1513: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1514:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1515: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1516:     receive
 1517: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1518:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1519: 	    ok
 1520:     after 5000 ->
 1521: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1522:     end,
 1523: 
 1524:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1525:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1526:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1527:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1528: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1529: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1530:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1531:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1532:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1533:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1534:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1535: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1536:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1537:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1538:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1539:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1540:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1541: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1542: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1543: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1544: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1545: 	Error ->
 1546: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1547: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1548: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1549:     end.
 1550: 
 1551: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1552:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1553:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1554:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1555:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1556: 
 1557:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1558:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1559:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1560:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1561:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1562:     Collect = 
 1563:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1564:                 receive
 1565:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1566:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1567:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1568:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1569:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1570:                 after 100 ->
 1571:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1572:                 end
 1573:         end,
 1574:  
 1575:     %% Install the test handler:
 1576:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1577:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1578:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1579:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1580:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1581:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1582:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1583:                                    ok
 1584:                            end,
 1585:                            self()),
 1586: 
 1587:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1588: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1589: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1590: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1591: 
 1592:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1593: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1594: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1595: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1596: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1597:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1598:     [true|_] =
 1599:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1600:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1601:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1602:     
 1603:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1604:     timer:sleep(500),
 1605:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1606:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1607: 
 1608:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1609:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1610:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1611:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1612:     end.
 1613:     
 1614: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1615:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1616:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1617:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1618:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1619:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1620: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1621: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1622: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1623: 
 1624:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1625: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1626: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1627: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1628: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1629: 
 1630: 
 1631:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1632:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1633:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1634:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1635:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1636:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1637: 
 1638:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1639:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1640:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1641:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1642:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1643:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1644:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1645:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1646: 
 1647:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1648:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1649: 
 1650: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1651: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1652:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1653:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1654:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1655:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1656:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1657: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1658: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1659: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1660: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1661: 					    ]),
 1662: 
 1663:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1664: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1665: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1666: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1667: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1668: 
 1669:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1670:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1671:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1672:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1673:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1674:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1675:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1676:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1677:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1678:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1679: 
 1680:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1681:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1682: 
 1683:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1684:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1685:     receive
 1686: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1687: 	    ok
 1688:     after 5000 ->
 1689: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1690:     end,
 1691: 
 1692:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1693:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1694: 
 1695:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1696:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1697:     receive
 1698: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1699: 	    ok
 1700:     after 5000 ->
 1701: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1702:     end,
 1703: 
 1704:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1705:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1706: 
 1707:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1708:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1709: 
 1710:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1711:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1712:     
 1713:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1714:     receive
 1715: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1716:     after 5000 ->
 1717: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1718: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1719: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1720: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1721:     end,
 1722: 
 1723:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1724:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1725: 
 1726:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1727:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1728: 
 1729:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1730:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1731: 
 1732: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1733: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1734: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1735: 
 1736: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1737:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1738:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1739: 				  "echo testing", infinity),
 1740:     %% receive response to input
 1741:     receive
 1742: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"testing\n">>}} ->
 1743: 	    ok
 1744:     after
 1745: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1746:     end,
 1747: 
 1748:     %% receive close messages
 1749:     receive
 1750: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1751: 	    ok
 1752:     after
 1753: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1754:     end,
 1755:     receive
 1756: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1757: 	    ok
 1758:     after
 1759: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1760:     end,
 1761:     receive
 1762: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1763: 	    ok
 1764:     after
 1765: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1766:     end.
 1767: 
 1768: 
 1769: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1770: flush_msgs() ->
 1771:     flush_msgs([]).
 1772: 
 1773: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1774:     receive
 1775:         M ->
 1776:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1777:                 true ->
 1778:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1779:                 _ ->
 1780:                     flush_msgs()
 1781:             end
 1782:     after
 1783:         500 -> ok
 1784:     end.
 1785: 
 1786: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1787: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1788:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1789: 
 1790: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1791:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1792:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1793:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1794:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1795:     receive
 1796:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1797:             flush_msgs();
 1798: 
 1799:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1800:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1801: 
 1802:         R ->
 1803:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1804:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1805:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1806: 
 1807:     after 5000 ->
 1808:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1809:     end.
 1810: 
 1811: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1812: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1813:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1814:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1815:     receive
 1816:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1817:             flush_msgs();
 1818:         R ->
 1819:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1820:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1821:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1822:     after 5000 ->
 1823:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1824:     end.
 1825: 
 1826: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1827: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1828:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1829: 
 1830: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1831:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1832: 
 1833: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1834:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1835:     case PtyOpts of
 1836:         [] ->
 1837:             no_alloc;
 1838:         _ ->
 1839:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1840:     end,
 1841:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1842: 
 1843:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1844:     receive
 1845: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1846: 	    flush_msgs();
 1847: 
 1848:         R ->
 1849:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1850:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1851:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1852: 
 1853:     after 5000 ->
 1854: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1855:     end.
 1856: 
 1857: 
 1858: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1859:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1860: 
 1861: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1862:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1863:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1864:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1865:     receive
 1866:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1867:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1868:         Other ->
 1869:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1870:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1871:     after 5000 ->
 1872:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1873:     end.
 1874: 
 1875: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1876: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1877:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1878: 
 1879: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1880:     receive
 1881: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1882: 	    %% ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1883: 	    %% window was pre-adjusted, don't adjust again here
 1884: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1885: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1886: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1887:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1888: 	    timeout
 1889:     end.
 1890: 
 1891: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1892:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1893:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1894: 
 1895: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1896:     TO = 5000,
 1897:     receive
 1898: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1899: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1900: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1901: 	    ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1902: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1903: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1904: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1905: 
 1906: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1907: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1908: 
 1909: 	Msg ->
 1910: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1911: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1912: 
 1913:     after TO ->
 1914: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1915: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1916:     end.
 1917: 
 1918: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1919:     try
 1920: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1921:     of
 1922: 	Bin ->
 1923: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1924: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1925: 	    Bin
 1926:     catch
 1927: 	C:E ->
 1928: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1929: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1930: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1931:     end.
 1932: 
 1933: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1934: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1935: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1936:     spawn(fun() ->
 1937: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1938: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1939:           end).
 1940: 
 1941: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1942:     spawn(fun() ->
 1943:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 1944:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 1945:           end).
 1946: 
 1947: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 1948:     spawn(fun() ->
 1949:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1950:           end).
 1951: 
 1952: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 1953:     spawn(fun() ->
 1954:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1955:           end).
